_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Sunoco, LLC - Caddo Mills Terminal is a bulk petroleum storage and distribution facility that includes butane blending operations.  This Risk Management Plan (RMP) covers the butane blending system, including the two 60,000 gallon butane storage vessels and associated piping and transfer equipment.



The Caddo Mills Terminal Butane Blending System was constructed and is maintained in accordance with the National Fire Protection Association Code #58 for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage (NFPA #58, 2011 edition) and it is the facility's policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws/codes. Caddo Mills Terminal complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) Accident Prevention Rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D), the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) standard (29 CFR Part 1910.119) along with its fourteen (14) compliance elements, and all applicable state and local laws and regulations.



Caddo Mills Terminal has been designates a "non-responding" facility. As such, if an emergency were to occur, the response protocol is to notify the Caddo Mills Volunteer Fire Department as well as the Hunt County LEPC and evacuate as necessary. The Facility emergency response plans are coordinated with fire department and Hunt County LEPC annually at minimum and the Caddo Mills Volunteer Fire Department has participated in the initial RMP/PSM training session for this system.Medical emergencies will require notification of the local Emergency Medical Services (Hunt County EMS) and Presbyterian Hospital of Greenville.



This facility has never had an accident involving the butane process which has resulted in deaths, injuries, property/environmental damage, evacuations or sheltering in place.



In an effort to improve and promote system safety, Sunoco looks for, and seeks employee input, on process safety improvements. Additionally, the Caddo Mills Volunteer Fire Department is contacted periodically re
garding participation in site emergency response drills.
